data.title: Avoid backticks (fixes #13098)
data.body: fixes #13098

data.title: File starting with "hidden " doesn't appear in file explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win10 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a file named "Hidden from VScode.md" or similar name starting with "hidden " or "Hidden "
2. Open the folder containing that file

Result:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6685088/19010013/e53fc91e-872e-11e6-9724-1a18f6d83374.png)

The blank spot between the two there otherwise behaves normally and will successfully open "hidden file.txt"

data.title: Double clicking Release Notes preview mode tab closes editor and goes to website
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Follow test plan to enable in product release notes in insiders https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12520
2 Help > Release Notes
3. The release notes are shown in product as a preview mode editor.
4. Double click the tab header to try and persist the editor

Editor disappears and a browser window is opened to the insiders release notes page.

data.title: Windows: selected tree item not accessible
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c96822698cdbd47b8245fb5f9f45a0168bc9da33, 2016-09-30T17:37:14.267Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: `dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.0.7`, `eg2.tslint-0.5.39`

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use nvda for accessibility testing
2. Open Command Palette with keyboard shortcut
3. Type something
4. Use arrow keys to navigate list
5. Observe: nvda keeps re-reading the entered text, not the selected item which makes it inaccessible for nvda users

data.title: Missing localizations in 1.6
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 insiders
- OS Version: doesn't matter

**In Menu Items:**
1. Help -> Search (Mac OS X)
2. View -> Toggle Render Whitespace
3. Edit -> Start Dictation (Mac OS X)

**In Settings:**
1. The below is not localized in **User Settings**, but is localized in Workspace Settings
   `// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings`
2. The below is not localized in **Keyboard Shortcut settings**
   `// Place your key bindings in this file to overwrite the defaults`

**In Launch.json**
Tooltips for all properties except the below are not localized in launch.json
- name
- type
- request
- preLaunch task

**while debugging**
1. The title for the Debug Console in German appears as "DebugKonsole". There should be a space between the "Debug" and the "Console"
2. Add watch for a symbol. When it is not available, the value says "not available" in English

**while closing unsaved files**
The dialog box that appears has text that is not localized

data.title: Tooltips/Comments not localized in settings.json for settings from built-in extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6 insiders

All settings related to css, sass, less, html, json and markdown.

This might be because these come from extensions that are built in?

data.title: Can't install VSIX into VS Code Insiders
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download latest C# extension beta release: https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/releases/download/v1.5-beta2/csharp-1.5.0-beta2.vsix
2. In VS Code, use File->Open to open the VSIX.

**Expected Result**: Extension installs

**Actual Result**:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/116161/19007405/c0968342-8719-11e6-93f9-d465f4c20a56.png)

data.title: Jsdoc type intellisense not working when using custom file extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

In a .js file, intellisense provides correct jsdoc types
![js](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9643219/19006509/20ad4dec-8760-11e6-9c36-94f46308d147.JPG)

In a custom extension file associated with javascript, types from jsdoc are not provided
![sj](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9643219/19006504/1a07fa0a-8760-11e6-9c01-4af978f2e6a6.JPG)
#### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a .sj file
2. In settings.json, set "files.associations": { "*.sj": "javascript" }
3. Create a function with jsdoc parameters with types
4. Call function and check if intellisense provides types

data.title: Files changing...
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:40:08.699Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic

I haven't really found a pattern to it yet but sometimes when I change focus to a different tab, the code in the new tab copies to the tab I just left.  This is a real problem as you can imagine.  All of the sudden my code/servers just crash because vscode replaced chunks of code it wasn't supposed to.  What's worse is it doesn't always change the entire file, sometimes just parts of it are changed which means time wasted on debugging.  Usually Ctrl z can reverse this pretty quickly but the file changes are very disturbing.  I may have to go back to vim...but I'd rather use this tool.

Regards, Jp Gaines

data.title: Diff editor does not ask to save when closing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c96822698cdbd47b8245fb5f9f45a0168bc9da33, 2016-09-30T17:37:14.267Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: `chrmarti.regex-0.0.6`, `DavidAnson.vscode-markdownlint-0.5.0`, `dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.0.6`, `eg2.tslint-0.5.39`, `ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1`, `msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-0.5.2`, `seanmcbreen.Spell-0.8.6`

Smoke-testing

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open diff editor from Git viewlet
2. Make change in current version
3. Close editor -> no dialog asking for saving which is inconsistent with the regular editor

Open Editors shows no editor, but 1 UNSAVED. Closing the window / opening another folder correctly asks for saving the file.

data.title: Need to save twice for json, js and css files to save changes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 insiders (c96822698cdbd47b8245fb5f9f45a0168bc9da33)
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan (10.11.6)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any json/js/css file, make changes, attempt to save either via Cmd+S, or File -> Save, or Save All from the Opened Editors section in the explorer
2. The dirty/unsaved indicator on the tab flickers to saved state and then back to unsaved state.
3. Save again and the file is saved

Doesn't happen in Windows

data.title: Emoji keyboard opens in the wrong place
data.body:
Ctrl+cmd+space to open this on OSX. Sometimes it's on the wrong monitor, sometimes it's fairly close like in the gif. Everywhere else in the system, it opens pointing at the cursor or focused input box, so I'm guessing it's something we actually have control over somehow. If the cursor is in a basic input box like the find widget, marketplace search box, etc, then it shows up in the right place.

![sep-30-2016 11-10-27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/19001958/a2c6f254-86fe-11e6-91cc-9be958f40b94.gif)

data.title: [themes] Dark+ theme can possibly have different colors for properties and variables

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Reported by @emzero in Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage#282

VS Code
Version 1.5.3
Commit 5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27
Date 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0

Latest TypeScript and Javascript Grammar 0.0.2

Windows 7 SP1 x64

Is it possible to have different colors for local variables and object properties?

Using the Latest TypeScript and Javascript Grammar it seems that some themes are able to do this but not the default ones. Not sure if it's something related to the themes or to the TmLanguage.

Default Dark+
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/412489/18977251/fed24e06-868e-11e6-98f9-d45f2de71041.png)

Monokai Dimmed
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/412489/18977259/1889cf18-868f-11e6-9aba-e00633b2c768.png)

data.title: Missing dependencies in debian package

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: debian jessie

Steps to Reproduce:
1. build_deps="curl ca-certificates"
2. apt-get update
3. DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends ${build_deps}
4. curl -L https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=760868 -o /code.deb
5. dpkg -i /code.deb
6. DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y -f --no-install-recommends
7. DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get purge -y --auto-remove ${build_deps}
8. rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/\* /code.deb

Does not install the following libraries

```
libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0
libgdk-x11-2.0.so.0
libatk-1.0.so.0
libpangocairo-1.0.so.0
libcairo.so.2
libpango-1.0.so.0
libfreetype.so.6
libfontconfig.so.1
libdbus-1.so.3
libXi.so.6
libXcursor.so.1
libXdamage.so.1
libXrandr.so.2
libXcomposite.so.1
libXext.so.6
libXfixes.so.3
libXrender.so.1
libXtst.so.6
libgconf-2.so.4
libasound.so.2
libcups.so.2
libexpat.so.1
```

The dependencies of the .deb package are

```
root@2cb088d9c151:/# apt-cache show code | grep ^Depends
Depends: libnotify4, libnss3
```
- Suggestion - Add a similar subset to the dependency list

```
libgtk2.0
libatk1.0
libpango1.0
libpangocairo-1.0
libcairo2
libfreetype6
libfontconfig1
libdbus-1-3
libxi6
libxcursor1
libxdamage1
libxrandr2
libxcomposite1
libxext6
libxfixes3
libxrender1
libxtst6
libgconf-2-4
libasound2
libcups2
libexpat1
```

and now

```
libxss1
```

data.title: Multi select option for the file explorer
data.body: I think multi select option in the file explorer similar to visual studio would be helpful and save lot of time for the developers in file management.

data.title: Custom ANSI colors in integrated terminal
data.body: @Tyriar this issue (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/143) mentions the ability to setup custom ANSI colors via settings.json but I haven't found how to do this yet. Is it supported?

data.title: Right click "find definition and Peek does not work with files in open folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.5.3
- OS Version: Linux Mint 4.2.0-27-generic #32~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jan 22 15:32:26 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open git repo folder in code, python files
2. right click select "Go to Definition"

Nothing happens, definition file.py is in same folder
Same with "peek definition"
Find all References just displays "loading"

It used to work but I have upgraded code twice since then.

data.title: C syntax highlighter uses wrong colors after some macro definitions.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu Gnome 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new C file. 
2. Copy&paste this code:

```
/* Syntax highlighting works here. */

#define TEST1 f(5)

/* Syntax highlighting is all messed up here. */

/* Workaround. */
#define TEST2 (f(5))

/* Now it's good again. */
```
1. Observe that the second and third comments have the wrong color applied to them.

![vscodecolor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11418469/18997300/c6ce81b4-8701-11e6-80a2-082f91ef5492.PNG)

data.title: Error installing VSCode on Microsoft Surface Pro 3
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5 and Insiders build (tried them both)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 
  Microsoft Surface Pro 3 i7, 256gb hard drive, 8gb RAM (up to date on all Windows Updates as of 09/28/16).

Problem: I can the program running and working on my computer perfectly fine until about 3 weeks ago it stopped working. I uninstalled, deleted config files, reinstalled and it still wouldn't work. I installed the Insiders Build and it worked for a few days but then it too stopped working. Now, if I installed the program and go through the installation it appears that everything is working fine. However, when I go to launch the program, it merely tries to open it but then nothing happens. No error message or issue pops up. I've tried running the program as an Administrator and under compatibility mode but nothing seems to work. Can you please help me figure out why this software won't run on my computer?

data.title: Fix spanish menu typo
data.body: Fixed a small typo where the spanish word for "Extensions" had a space in between.

data.title: Order command palette by usage
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5

When searching for items in the command palette, it would be nice if it ordered the items by usage amount. So if I use command `az` more than command `aa`, it would be nice if command `az` showed up first when I typed `a` into the search.

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
